title: Apache Airflow Core Concepts
description: The official documentation outlining the essential architecture of Airflow, including DAGs, Operators, and the Scheduler. It provides the necessary vocabulary and structural understanding before writing code.

title: Apache Airflow Tutorial for Beginners
description: A highly practical video walkthrough that guides you through installing Airflow with Docker and creating your first DAG. It visually demonstrates the UI and basic task dependencies.

title: Writing Your First DAG
description: A step-by-step written guide focused on code structure, defining tasks, and setting dependencies. It bridges the gap between conceptual understanding and actual implementation.

title: dbt Fundamentals
description: The official free certification course from dbt Labs. It covers setting up a project, connecting to a data warehouse, and running your first models and tests.

title: Jaffle Shop Tutorial
description: The canonical example project for dbt. Cloning and running this repository allows beginners to see a best-practice project structure and play with working models.

title: What is dbt?
description: A concise video explanation of the 'T' in ELT. It explains why analytics engineering exists and how dbt fits into the modern data stack alongside warehouses like Snowflake or BigQuery.

title: SQL Window Functions Tutorial
description: An interactive tutorial specifically for Window Functions (OVER, PARTITION BY). This is often the first 'advanced' concept beginners encounter and is crucial for data engineering.

title: CTEs (Common Table Expressions) Explained
description: A clear guide on how to use `WITH` clauses to simplify complex queries. Essential for writing readable, maintainable SQL code in production environments.

title: PostgreSQL Exercises
description: A hands-on platform offering graded SQL challenges ranging from simple joins to complex aggregations. It provides immediate feedback and is excellent for building muscle memory.

title: Amazon S3 Introduction
description: The foundational documentation for AWS's object storage service. Understanding buckets, objects, and storage classes is the first step for any AWS data engineer.

title: AWS Lambda for Data Engineers
description: A tutorial focusing on serverless compute. Learn how to trigger simple Python scripts from S3 events, a common pattern for lightweight data transformation.

title: Understanding AWS IAM Roles
description: Identity and Access Management is critical for security. This resource explains how roles and policies work, ensuring your data pipelines have the correct permissions without exposing credentials.

title: Organizing DAGs with TaskGroups
description: Learn to group related tasks within the Airflow UI without the performance penalties of legacy SubDAGs. This feature is essential for maintaining readable and manageable complex pipelines.

title: Mastering Airflow Sensors
description: A deep dive into using Sensors to make DAGs event-driven, waiting for files in S3 or data in a SQL table. Covers the critical 'poke' vs 'reschedule' modes to optimize slot usage.

title: Building Custom Operators
description: A practical tutorial on extending Airflow by writing your own Python classes for specific business logic. Moves beyond standard library operators to create reusable, custom integrations.

title: Configuring Incremental Models
description: Understanding how to configure models to only transform new or changed data. This is the single most important technique for reducing warehouse costs and runtimes in large-scale dbt projects.

title: Writing DRY Code with Jinja Macros
description: Learn to use Jinja templating to create reusable SQL snippets (macros) and packages. Essential for abstracting complex logic and maintaining cleaner codebases.

title: Managing Static Data and Snapshots
description: A guide on using `dbt seed` for version-controlled lookup tables and `dbt snapshot` for implementing Type 2 Slowly Changing Dimensions (SCD) to track historical data changes.

title: Recursive CTEs for Hierarchical Data
description: Mastering the `WITH RECURSIVE` syntax to query hierarchical structures like organizational charts or tree-based data. A challenging but powerful SQL pattern.

title: Reading Query Execution Plans
description: Learn how to use `EXPLAIN ANALYZE` to understand how the database engine executes a query. Critical for identifying bottlenecks, missing indexes, and expensive sorts.

title: Querying Semi-Structured JSON Data
description: Techniques for flattening and extracting data from JSON columns within a relational database. Focuses on syntax common in PostgreSQL and Snowflake (lateral flattens, arrow operators).

title: Authoring AWS Glue ETL Jobs
description: An introduction to serverless data integration. Learn to write PySpark scripts within Glue to transform data moved from S3 to Redshift without managing servers.

title: Redshift Distribution & Sort Keys
description: A critical architecture concept for cloud warehousing. Learn how to choose the right keys (Key, Even, All) to minimize data shuffling during joins and maximize query performance.

title: Optimizing Cost with Athena Partitioning
description: Learn how to partition S3 data (by year/month/day) to drastically reduce the amount of data scanned by Athena queries, directly lowering costs and improving speed.

title: Scaling with the Kubernetes Executor
description: A comprehensive guide to running Airflow on Kubernetes, allowing each task to run in its own pod. This is the gold standard for resource isolation and scaling in enterprise production environments.

title: Testing and CI/CD for Data Pipelines
description: Learn to treat DAGs as software by implementing unit tests, integration tests, and DAG integrity tests within a CI/CD pipeline (GitHub Actions/Jenkins). Focuses on preventing broken code from reaching production.

title: Developing Custom Airflow Plugins
description: Master the architecture of Airflow by writing custom plugins to extend the UI, add new executors, or integrate with internal systems. Required for platform engineering teams building on top of Airflow.

title: Creating Custom Materializations
description: The deepest level of dbt programming: writing the adapter logic that determines how SQL is executed against the warehouse (e.g., creating 'insert_by_period' or custom merge logic).

title: Optimizing Pipelines with Slim CI
description: Learn to implement 'Slim CI' using state deferral (`--defer` and `--state`) to only run models that have been modified in a Pull Request. Critical for keeping CI times low in massive monorepos.

title: Building and Distributing dbt Packages
description: Move beyond using packages to creating them. Learn how to structure a dbt project as a library to share macros, models, and tests across multiple teams in an organization.

title: Database Internals and Indexing Strategy
description: A low-level deep dive into B-Trees, Heap architecture, and how the query optimizer chooses execution plans. Essential for debugging queries that 'should' be fast but aren't.

title: Procedural SQL and Triggers (PL/pgSQL)
description: Writing complex control structures, triggers, and stored procedures within the database. Focuses on handling transactional logic that cannot be expressed in standard declarative SQL.

title: Advanced Window Frame Specifications
description: Mastering the `ROWS/RANGE BETWEEN` clauses to calculate rolling averages, moving sums, and sessionization logic. Covers unbounded preceding/following and handling gaps in time-series data.

title: Building a Transactional Data Lake with Apache Iceberg
description: Learn to implement the Lakehouse architecture using Apache Iceberg on AWS S3 and Glue. Enables ACID transactions, time travel, and schema evolution on raw object storage.

title: Tuning Spark Applications on EMR
description: Advanced configuration for EMR clusters, focusing on memory management, executor sizing, garbage collection tuning, and spot instance strategies for massive scale data processing.

title: Infrastructure as Code with AWS CDK
description: Defining complex data infrastructure (VPCs, Redshift clusters, Glue Jobs, IAM roles) using TypeScript or Python. Moves operations from 'ClickOps' to reproducible, version-controlled software.

title: Responsive Web Design Certification
description: A comprehensive, hands-on curriculum where you build real projects (like a Tribute Page and Portfolio) to learn HTML and CSS. It focuses heavily on accessibility and modern layout techniques like Flexbox and Grid.

title: Getting Started with the Web
description: The gold standard for web documentation. This module provides a practical introduction to web development, covering how the internet works, publishing your first site, and the basics of HTML structure.

title: JavaScript30
description: A 30-day challenge to build 30 small projects using only vanilla JavaScript (no frameworks). It is excellent for beginners who know basic syntax but struggle to apply it to build interactive elements.

title: Server-side Website Programming
description: A conceptual guide that explains what happens on the server, the difference between static and dynamic sites, and how to choose a framework. It avoids code initially to focus on the 'how' and 'why' of the backend.

title: CS50's Web Programming with Python
description: The follow-up to Harvard's famous CS50. This course dives into the design and implementation of web apps with Python, JavaScript, and SQL, using frameworks like Django and React.

title: Node.js Crash Course
description: A fast-paced video tutorial that gets a server running in minutes. It covers the fundamentals of Node.js, modules, and the file system before building a simple server without frameworks.

title: Pro Git (Chapters 1-3)
description: The official, open-source book on Git. The first three chapters are the definitive guide for beginners, covering getting a repo, recording changes, viewing history, and the basics of branching.

title: GitHub Skills
description: An interactive learning experience where a bot guides you through creating pull requests, merging code, and hosting pages directly within a real GitHub repository.

title: Git and GitHub for Beginners
description: A comprehensive video course that visualizes what Git is doing under the hood. It covers installation, staging, committing, pushing to remote, and handling merge conflicts.

title: Managing State in React
description: The official deep dive into structuring state, preserving state between re-renders, and scaling with reducers and context. It moves beyond simple `useState` to architectural patterns for complex UIs.

title: The TypeScript Handbook: Generics & Narrowing
description: The definitive guide to moving beyond basic types. Focuses on Generics, Type Narrowing, and Utility Types, which are essential for writing reusable and type-safe libraries or application logic.

title: Web Vitals and Performance
description: Learn the metrics that drive user experience (LCP, CLS, FID). This resource explains how to measure, debug, and optimize rendering performance using Chrome DevTools.

title: Node.js Best Practices
description: The industry-standard GitHub repository containing over 80 best practices for error handling, code style, project structure, and security in Node.js applications.

title: Odyssey: Lift-off with GraphQL
description: A high-quality interactive course that teaches how to design a schema, build resolvers, and query data. It transitions developers from REST API thinking to the graph paradigm.

title: Redis for Backend Developers
description: Learn when and how to implement caching to reduce database load. Covers data structures, expiration policies, and the difference between caching and primary storage.

title: Best Practices for Writing Dockerfiles
description: Move beyond `docker run`. Learn about multi-stage builds to reduce image size, layer caching to speed up builds, and security scanning for containers.

title: Building CI/CD Workflows
description: Learn to automate testing and deployment using GitHub Actions. Covers writing YAML workflows, using secrets, and triggering jobs on specific events like Pull Requests.

title: The Twelve-Factor App
description: A methodology for building software-as-a-service apps. It defines the intermediate standard for handling config, backing services, logs, and concurrency in modern applications.

title: Advanced Rendering Patterns
description: A deep dive into modern web architecture, comparing Server-Side Rendering (SSR), Static Site Generation (SSG), Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR), and Hydration strategies. Essential for architects choosing the right stack for scale.

title: Micro-Frontends Architecture
description: The definitive guide to splitting monolithic frontend codebases into smaller, manageable pieces. It covers integration techniques (build-time vs. run-time), styling isolation, and shared state challenges.

title: High Performance Browser Networking
description: An engineer's guide to the low-level networking performance of the browser. Covers HTTP/2, HTTP/3, TCP/UDP internals, TLS handshakes, and how they impact application latency and rendering.

title: The Amazon Builders' Library
description: A collection of living articles by AWS senior principal engineers describing how they build and operate distributed systems. Topics include implementing shuffle sharding, handling leader election, and avoiding cascading failures.

title: Domain Driven Design (DDD)
description: A strategic approach to modeling complex software based on the domain it serves. This resource explains Bounded Contexts, Aggregates, and Entities, which are crucial for designing loose coupling in microservices.

title: Kafka: The Definitive Guide (Internals)
description: Go beyond producing and consuming messages to understanding the controller, replication protocols, log compaction, and request processing. Critical for engineers managing high-throughput streaming data.

title: Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
description: The foundational text on how Google runs production systems. It introduces concepts like Service Level Objectives (SLOs), Error Budgets, and the elimination of toil through automation.

title: Kubernetes The Hard Way
description: A tutorial that walks you through bootstrapping a Kubernetes cluster without using installation scripts. You will manually install certificates, etcd, and worker nodes to understand the internal architecture.

title: Terraform Best Practices
description: Advanced patterns for Infrastructure as Code (IaC), including module composition, state management (remote backends), and structuring large-scale repositories to prevent code drift.
